subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: Tristan Gommendy, a 27-year-old French rookie, looked on through yesterday’s rain-marred qualifying session for the inaugural Champ Car Mont-Tremblant as the provisional pole he won in Friday’s session stood up as the fastest qualifying time for today’s race in Quebec. Will Power took the second spot on the front row with the fastest lap yesterday at 1:20.943. That was well off Gommendy’s pole-winning time of 1:16.776 on Friday.
